intro: Neochilenia krausii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. Neochilenia krausii typically grows in mountainous areas and is adapted to high-altitude environments with cool temperatures. Its leaves are usually broad and hairy, providing a distinctive appearance that aids in its identification.
